messages.text:
> Hi Team,
> I want to use query insights dashboard plugin with Opensearch Dashboard 2.18 - I don’t see any version specific branch in query insights dashboard plugin github <https://github.com/opensearch-project/query-insights-dashboards/tree/main?tab=readme-ov-file|repo> (which is generally the case for other plugins) - Does it mean that the main branch is compatible with all versions of OSD? If not, can anyone please suggest what steps do I need to take to integrate this plugin with OSD 2.18?
Hi Team,
Does anyone have any update on this?

elements.text:

messages.text:
Hello, I'm testing out Opensearch 2.18 with the Discover functionality for PPL and I've noticed that it always runs into Internal Server errors (except if I don't use a single Pipe and just select "source = logs*"). Even if I just run "source = logs* | head 10" there is an internal Server error. On the Opensearch side it's always a NullPointerException
(`2024-11-25T14:56:14,543][INFO`
 `][o.o.s.p.PPLService       ] [opensearch-cluster-master-2]` 
`[76771ece-0e69-47ca-ad08-615ace71f08e] Incoming request` 
`source=logs.mwil-sand-sand.* | where time >= *** and time <= *** |`
 `head 10 | stats count(null) | fields + null`
`[2024-11-25T14:56:14,562][ERROR][o.o.s.p.r.RestPPLQueryAction]`
 `[opensearch-cluster-master-2] Error happened during query handling`
`java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "java.lang.Comparable.compareTo(Object)" because "k1" is null`
	`at java.base/java.util.TreeMap.compare(TreeMap.java:1604) ~[?:?]`
	`at java.base/java.util.TreeMap.addEntryToEmptyMap(TreeMap.java:811) ~[?:?]`
	`at java.base/java.util.TreeMap.put(TreeMap.java:820) ~[?:?]`
	`at java.base/java.util.TreeMap.putIfAbsent(TreeMap.java:574) ~[?:?]`
	`at org.opensearch.sql.planner.physical.collector.BucketCollector.collect(BucketCollector.java:53) ~[core-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`
	`at org.opensearch.sql.planner.physical.AggregationOperator.open(AggregationOperator.java:79) ~[core-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`
	`at java.base/java.util.Collections$SingletonList.forEach(Collections.java:5186) ~[?:?]`
	`at org.opensearch.sql.planner.physical.PhysicalPlan.open(PhysicalPlan.java:29) ~[core-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`

	`at` 
`org.opensearch.sql.opensearch.executor.OpenSearchExecutionEngine.lambda$execute$0(OpenSearchExecutionEngine.java:49)`
 `[opensearch-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`

	`at` 
`org.opensearch.sql.opensearch.client.OpenSearchNodeClient.schedule(OpenSearchNodeClient.java:193)`
 `[opensearch-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`

	`at` 
`org.opensearch.sql.opensearch.executor.OpenSearchExecutionEngine.execute(OpenSearchExecutionEngine.java:43)`
 `[opensearch-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`
	`at org.opensearch.sql.executor.QueryService.lambda$executePlan$1(QueryService.java:66) [core-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`
	`at java.base/java.util.Optional.ifPresentOrElse(Optional.java:198) [?:?]`
	`at org.opensearch.sql.executor.QueryService.executePlan(QueryService.java:63) [core-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`
	`at org.opensearch.sql.executor.QueryService.execute(QueryService.java:41) [core-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`
	`at org.opensearch.sql.executor.execution.QueryPlan.execute(QueryPlan.java:65) [core-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`

	`at` 
`org.opensearch.sql.opensearch.executor.OpenSearchQueryManager.lambda$submit$0(OpenSearchQueryManager.java:31)`
 `[opensearch-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`

	`at` 
`org.opensearch.sql.opensearch.executor.OpenSearchQueryManager.lambda$withCurrentContext$1(OpenSearchQueryManager.java:45)`
 `[opensearch-2.18.0.0.jar:?]`

	`at` 
`org.opensearch.common.util.concurrent.ThreadContext$ContextPreservingRunnable.run(ThreadContext.java:946)`
 `[opensearch-2.18.0.jar:2.18.0]`
	`at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1144) [?:?]`
	`at java.base/java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:642) [?:?]`
	`at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1583) [?:?]`).

Is this a problem in the implementation or perhaps with my data?

elements.text:
Hello, I'm testing out Opensearch 2.18 with the Discover functionality for PPL and I've noticed that it always runs into Internal Server errors (except if I don't use a single Pipe and just select "source = logs*"). Even if I just run "source = logs* | head 10" there is an internal Server error. On the Opensearch side it's always a NullPointerException
(
java.lang.NullPointerException: Cannot invoke "java.lang.Comparable.compareTo(Object)" because "k1" is null

).

Is this a problem in the implementation or perhaps with my data?

messages.text:
Hello
I am facing a kind-of blocking issue (for us) on an Opensearch dashboard instance
```On opensearch dashboard I got this error null_pointer_exception
Cannot invoke "org.opensearch.search.aggregations.InternalAggregations.getSerializedSize()" because "reducePhase.aggregations" is null
Error: Internal Server Error```
So impossible to make a single search :disappointed:
I did not see errors on the logs except this one in opensearch dashboard logs
```"res":{"statusCode":500,"responseTime":78,"contentLength":9},"message":"POST /internal/search/opensearch 500 78ms - 9.0B"}```
on master and data node logs there are no errors related to that except
```level=error ts=2024-11-05T08:54:31.189720321Z caller=indices.go:1126 err="HTTP Request failed with code 403"
level=warn ts=2024-11-05T08:54:31.189786421Z caller=indices.go:1207 msg="failed to fetch and decode index stats" err="HTTP Request failed with code 403"```
what could the cause here? where I can get more details about the error?
I am using a 2.4.0 version

Hello there. I have an ec2 with opensearch dashboard installed and I'm trying to configure two aws opensearch domains
How can I have the two aws opensearch domains active ? I only see one opensearch domain.
is this even possible? I want to have one dashboard with multiple opensearch domains so I would be login in one dashboard and then select the domains.

messages.text:
Hi, can I know if there are any different ways to check if an OSD cluster is valid other than using the api call `<http://localhost:5601/api/status>`
Please check the related issue <https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/issues/5117#issuecomment-2423353715|here>

attachments.fallback: Comment on #5117 [Bug]: Validation framework doesnot validate OSD bootstrapping
attachments.text:
Hi <https://github.com/AMoo-Miki|@AMoo-Miki>  
Do you know a better way to test if Dashboards is valid? We are only using one validation for OSD which is `<http://localhost:5601/api/status>`  
<https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/src/validation_workflow/api_test_cases.py#L36|https://github.com/opensearch-project/opensearch-build/blob/main/src/validation_workflow/api_test_cases.py#L36>
attachments.title: Comment on #5117 [Bug]: Validation framework doesnot validate OSD bootstrapping

messages.text:
I see that the OpenSearch helm chart <https://github.com/opensearch-project/helm-charts/blob/d4fd2581b3d1a23f74557e3fb5d298f7e0fea2cd/charts/opensearch-dashboards/values.yaml#L194C1-L196C19|sets default values for limits on CPU and memory>. Many argue that one should not set limits:
<https://home.robusta.dev/blog/stop-using-cpu-limits>

Any chance that the project can remove this from the helm chart?

attachments.fallback: For the Love of God, Stop Using CPU Limits on Kubernetes (Updated) | Robusta
attachments.text: Many people think you need CPU limits on Kubernetes but this isn't true. In most cases, Kubernetes CPU limits do more harm than help. In fact, they're the number one cause of Kubernetes CPU throttling.
attachments.title: For the Love of God, Stop Using CPU Limits on Kubernetes (Updated) | Robusta

elements.text: I see that the OpenSearch helm chart
sets default values for limits on CPU and memory
. Many argue that one should not set limits:
Any chance that the project can remove this from the helm chart?

root.text:
Hi everyone,

I'm working on a dashboard visualization, and I need to filter out certain values using a regular expression. Specifically, I’m trying to match patterns like this:
TEST-[a-z0-9]+/[a-zA-Z0-9-]+-tas-core-[a-z0-9]+-[a-z][a-z0-9]+.

The end goal is to visualize this filtered data as a line graph on the dashboard. However, I'm struggling with how to implement this in the visState JSON section of the dashboard defination.
Would anyone be able to share the correct syntax or provide any guidance on how I can apply this regex to display the data properly?
OSD Version : 2.12.0
Any help or suggestions would be greatly appreciated! Thanks in advance. :blush:

messages.text:
Hi @Wazuh Community,
I'm currently working on creating a custom OpenSearch plugin, and I want to add a link to the TheHive5 dashboard within the OpenSearch interface. However, I'm unsure of where to start. I have gone through the
documentation (<https://opensearch.org/docs/latest/install-and-configure/plugins/#install>), but it hasn't worked for me.
I've attached a file listing all the files in my plugin. Could anyone guide
me on which specific code file I need to modify to add the link to
TheHive5 dashboard? Additionally, I would really appreciate any
developer guides or advice on how to correctly implement this.

messages.text:
Is anyone actually using Alerting on top of anomaly detectors successfully ?
I can't figure out whats going on in our case. We have some detectors setup but i can't select a feature when setting up a trigger when creating a monitor. Im stuck at "No features have been added to this anomaly detector...". Checking the network tab it seems the plugin tries to get the detector via `<>/api/alerting/detectors/:id?startTime=XX&endTime=YY`  but the endpoint doesn't seem to support startTime (?) no matter what timestamp i try i always get
{
  "statusCode": 400,
  "error": "Bad Request",
  "message": "[request query.startTime]: definition for this key is missing"
}
Leaving out the startTime query returns the detectors...
I can reproduce this on the <https://opensearch.org/docs/latest/install-and-configure/install-opensearch/docker/> minimal docker compose setup from the docs on 2.17.X.
Am i missing something here ?

Hi Team

OSD Version : 2.4.0

I have small doubt regarding opensearch dashboards server, how many concurrent requests it can handle ?
is there a config for it ?
Current if i call my API for load testing on `search`
When request per second count cross 50, OSD server is not responding

What might be the issue ?
